relationships.description: Cohen provides financial and aviation management advice to Jeffrey Epstein
Colleagues working on aviation financial models
Cohen works with MWE aviation and tax counsel

analysis.purpose: To provide Jeffrey Epstein with a profit model for G650 aircraft operations and discuss aviation management decisions
analysis.significance: Shows detailed financial planning around Epstein's private aircraft operations and tax considerations

notable_quotes: after depreciation, we would show a profit. (In part because Apollo charter payments factor in depreciation)
we think we cannot use accelerated due to foreign travel preponderance, and obviously can't use bonus because not new
red_flags: Tax optimization discussions around aircraft depreciation
Mention of foreign travel preponderance affecting tax treatment

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this aviation management discussion

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses legitimate aviation management and tax planning without evidence of illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Private aircraft management discussions typically not public knowledge; reveals Epstein's use of sophisticated tax planning for aviation assets

analysis.summary: Barry J. Cohen provides Jeffrey Epstein with a profit model for G650 aircraft operations, discussing depreciation strategies, aircraft management options between Jet Aviation and EJM, and tax considerations related to foreign travel patterns and proposed Trump administration depreciation rules.
